attributes.description: Although Johnson & Johnson's main distribution plant is in Pennsyvania, USA, the main packaging plant is located in Belgium and, in fact, packaging labels do show Belgium as Zyrtec's place of origin.
attributes.address: Calle Senigallia, 30133 Giudecca Province of Venice, Italy
attributes.title: Zyrtec Packaging Plant

attributes.description: Polyethylene terephthalate (sometimes written poly(ethylene terephthalate)), commonly abbreviated PET, PETE, or the obsolete PETP or PET-P, is a thermoplastic polymer resin of the polyester family and is used in synthetic fibers; beverage, food and other liquid containers; thermoforming applications; and engineering resins often in combination with glass fiber.The majority of the world's PET production is for synthetic fibers (in excess of 60%), with bottle production accounting for around 30% of global demand.
attributes.title: Polyethylene Terephthalate

attributes.description: Polyethylene terephthalate (sometimes written poly(ethylene terephthalate)), commonly abbreviated PET, PETE, or the obsolete PETP or PET-P, is a thermoplastic polymer resin of the polyester family and is used in synthetic fibers; beverage, food and other liquid containers; thermoforming applications; and engineering resins often in combination with glass fiber. The majority of the world's PET production is for synthetic fibers (in excess of 60%), with bottle production accounting for around 30% of global demand.
attributes.title: Polyethylene Terephthalate

attributes.description: High-density polyethylene (HDPE) or polyethylene high-density (PEHD) is a polyethylene thermoplastic made from petroleum. It takes 1.75 kilograms of petroleum (in terms of energy and raw materials) to make one kilogram of HDPE. HDPE is commonly recycled, and has the number "2" as its recycling symbol. In 2007, the global HDPE market reached a volume of more than 30 million tons.[1]
attributes.title: High Density Polyethylene

attributes.description: High-density polyethylene (HDPE) or polyethylene high-density (PEHD) is a polyethylene thermoplastic made from petroleum. It takes 1.75 kilograms of petroleum (in terms of energy and raw materials) to make one kilogram of HDPE. HDPE is commonly recycled, and has the number "2" as its recycling symbol. In 2007, the global HDPE market reached a volume of more than 30 million tons.[1]
attributes.title: High Density Polyethylene

attributes.description:
Aluminum is produced from bauxite in two major stages:

1.alumina (aluminum oxide), a white, granular substance which looks somewhat like sugar, is refined from bauxite in a several-step caustic soda/high temperature process.
2.the alumina is electrolytically reduced in molten cryolite to separate it into aluminum and oxygen.
attributes.title: Bauxite (Aluminum Foil)

attributes.description: The center receives, inventories and ships Johnson & Johnson consumer products to both retailers and other distribution facilities.
attributes.title: Johnson & Johnson Distribution Mega Center

attributes.description: Winston Packaging is one of only a few packaging companies in the US to earn both FSC and SFI Chain of Custody Certification by third party auditor Bureau Veritas. This means that whether your project specifies FSC or SFI certified paperboard, recycled or recyclable paperboard, you can be sure you are making an environmentally responsible choice.
attributes.address: 8095 North Point Blvd, Winston-Salem, NC 27106, USA
attributes.title: SFI Paperboard
